required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Different β -Blockers in STEMI and Primary PCI
clinical_study.official_title: Different β -Blockers in Patients With ST-segment Myocardial Infarction Undergoing Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: Carvedilol, target dose: 50 mg daily; Bisoprolol, target dose: 10 mg daily; Metoprolol tartrate, target dose: 150 mg daily; Metroprolol succinate, target dose: 200 mg daily

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will investigate the efficacy and safety of different β -blockers, as well as heart rate variability, in STEMI patients undergoing primary PCI.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome of this study will be the change from baseline in left ventricular end diastolic volume (LVEDV) post-PCI.

intervention.description: Target doses of carvedilol, bisoprolol, metoprolol tartrate, or metroprolol succinate
